alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 21 at 3:32PM HST until December 22 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... .Surf along north and west facing shores will continue to trend down into Thursday as the large northwest (320 degrees) swell moves out. An upward trend is then expected late Thursday as a fresh, long-period, northwest (310 degrees) swell builds down the island chain. Surf associated with this swell will return to advisory levels for north and west facing shores late Thursday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Surf of 7 to 10 feet lowering to 6 to 8 feet Thursday. * WHERE...Kona and Kohala. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
